description: From Latin attractus, past participle of attrahere (“to draw to, attract”), from ad (“to”) + trahere (“to draw”).

verbs.description: attract (third-person singular simple present attracts, present participle attracting, simple past and past participle attracted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To draw by moral, emotional or sexual influence; to engage or fix, as the mind, attention, etc.; to invite or allure.
examples: Advertising is designed to attract customers.
His big smile and brown eyes instantly attracted me.
Using the minibar in a hotel room attracts additional charges.
